com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm
Class Commitment

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm.Commitment
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommitmentOpening
public class Commitment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class to express a Commitment to one or more messages. Commitments have the form C = Zm * Sr mod n, or the multi-base variant, which commits to L messages: C = R0m_0 * ... * RLm_L * Sr mod n. We store the values of Z, S, n and c. This class does not store the opening info of the commitment (i.e. the exponents).

See Also:
CommitmentOpening, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Commitment

public Commitment(java.math.BigInteger value,
                  IssuerPublicKey ipk)
Single message commitment constructor using a given commitment value and the issuer public key to retrieve the bases.

Parameters:
value - Value of the commitment, i.e. the product (R0m)*(Sr) mod n.
ipk - Issuer public key containing R0, S, and n.

Commitment

public Commitment(java.math.BigInteger value,
                  java.math.BigInteger capR_0,
                  java.math.BigInteger theCapS,
                  java.math.BigInteger theN)
Single message commitment constructor using a given bases.

Parameters:
value - Value of the commitment, i.e. the product (R0m)*(Sr) mod n.
capR_0 - Base for the message.
theCapS - Base for the randomizing factor.
theN - Modulus.

Commitment

public Commitment(java.math.BigInteger value,
                  IssuerPublicKey ipk,
                  int theNumBases)
Multi-base commitment constructor.

Parameters:
value - Commitment value R0m_0 * ... * RLm_L * Sr mod n.
ipk - Issuer's public key (used to retrieve the bases).
theNumBases - the number of messages committed

Commitment

public Commitment(java.math.BigInteger value,
                  java.util.Vector<java.math.BigInteger> theBases,
                  java.math.BigInteger theCapS,
                  java.math.BigInteger theN)
Multibase constructor.

Parameters:
value - the value of the commitment, i.e. the product (R_0^m)*...*(R_L^m_L)*(S^r) mod n.
theBases - a vector of the bases R_0, ..., R_L
theCapS - the base for the randomizer
theN - the modulus
